arts.ttl: Frank Lampard makes Barry Bannan admission as 'character' sees Coventry City to victory
arts.sum: “Two late winners in a week and it gives off a sign of the character and desire of the team to keep going,” said Lampard, speaking after the 2-1 away win which lifted City up to seventh place, just a place off sixth placed West Brom. Frank Lampard hailed Coventry City’s character after riding their luck against Sheffield Wednesday and travelling home with the full three points after scoring another late winner following their last gasp victory over QPR in midweek.

arts.ttl: Coventry City player ratings v Sheffield Wednesday after Ellis Simms snatches points at the death - Andy Turner
arts.sum: Wednesday finally made their pressure count but had City to thank for their equaliser just after the hour when Dasilva gave away possession that led to an attack which saw Marvin Johnson hit a cross in from the left and Oliver Dovin parried it into Latibeaudiere, with the ball bouncing off the defender and into the back of their own net for an own goal. City rode their luck with some bodies on the line defending required before they took the lead against the run of play when Simms got on the end of a Jack Rudoni cross to head home in the 16th minute.

arts.ttl: Ellis Simms’ brace earns Coventry victory at Sheffield Wednesday
arts.sum: The striker won it for the Sky Blues in stoppage time.

arts.ttl: Rule change call to get Coventry City man well-deserved international caps
arts.sum: Our sister title at WalesOnline report that it’s understood Welsh football chiefs are looking to persuade associations in England, Scotland and Northern Ireland to change the rules, which would allow players over the age of 18 that have been registered with a club in one of the home nations for at least five years to be eligible to represent that country. Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group.

arts.ttl: EFL pundit issues stark Doug King warning to Coventry City boss Frank Lampard
arts.sum: So far King’s decision to bring in former Chelsea boss Lampard has paid dividends with the 46-year-old coach lifting the team from three points off the relegation zone to three off the top six play-off mix – earning admiration from Sky Sports EFL pundit Don Goodman who has done a U-turn in his thinking, having previously written off City’s chances of promotion this season. Frank Lampard has been warned that he needs to do “more than okay” and get Coventry City promoted under the "current regime."

arts.ttl: Why free agent signing Jamie Paterson has provided Coventry City with a 'massive lift'
arts.sum: The Sky Blues striker says the 33-year-old winger/forward has been a huge boost to the squad with his presence on and off the training pitch, and feels he’s already struck up a nice playing connection with the former Swansea City man, who he hopes will help him score a few more goals. Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group.

arts.ttl: Confirmed: Frank Lampard completes his second Coventry City transfer
arts.sum: Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group. The 33-year-old Coventry-born forward has been training with the Sky Blues since just before Christmas after leaving MLS side Charlotte FC, with whom he’d been since August, having previously played for Swansea and Bristol City in the Championship.

arts.ttl: 'Dream come true' - Jamie Paterson opens up on love for hometown club Coventry City - CoventryLive
arts.sum: Explaining how he came to join the club for training last month, he said: “I was in America, and I came back, and I spoke with the Gaffer about coming into training and having a look and see where we feel I’m at and how I am. “It would always be an exciting time to be part of this club,” he said, “but that added bonus of having the opportunity to get promoted with your hometown team, I’m not sure what can beat that in your footballing career.”
